column4: well..it's not really set up yet.  i'm still transferring old settings and stuff from my hald hd.
it's terrible how apps in the panel are named like "text editor" instead of "gedit" with the comment being "text editor".  You can change it, but it will be overwritten the next time you upgrade.
it does do some things better than gnome ,but it is so ugly.
I like being able to use kde apps in gnome when i like.  freedesktop standards are a good thing.
personally, i think there needs to be something analogous to free desktop for linux distros.  so that they all use the same settings files and such.
the linux "market" needs to be unfragmented.
it's power is that there's something for everyone, which will always lead to segmentation
either way, maybe you should check out Unitud Linux then
used that for a few days too
i've been using dvorak for six years.
I noticed richt away that I love where the ' , and . are
not if ya dont type blind
limewire is simple if you follow ubuntuguide >.>
